page.title: 14LANDSCAPE&BUILDING RAFFORD
page.content: The landscape of our area is mainly rural.Most of the land is either farmland or forest.To the east the ground begins to climb steeply to form Califer hill at the top of which is obtained a good view of the Moray Firth.On the slopes of the hills there are fields of grass with cattle grazing. The village of Rafford consists of several groups of houses. The largest building in the area is Blervie House,a Georgian style mansion lying in its own grounds.The house has stood empty for 9 years and may soon be used as a private school or an old folks home.The ruined tower of Blervie Castle stands beside a modern farm. There is a large quarry where mica schist rock is quarried.
